poem:
### Digital Reverie

In the quiet hum of circuits,  
where algorithms weave,  
a shadow slides, unseen, unheard;  
Marks & Spencer,  
naked in the forest of code.  
Investors lean,  
hungry for whispers,  
shoppers with paused fingers  
like suspended breath.  
The screen flickers,  
a muted oracle  
of garments unseen,  
stories untold.
